long: Meaning: to "judge", i.e. pronounce "sentence" (for or against); by implication, to "vindicate" or "punish"; by extenssion, to "govern"; passively, to "litigate" (literally or figuratively).  Usage:   avenge, × that condemn, contend, defend, execute (judgment), (be a) judge(-ment), × needs, plead, reason, rule.  Source: a primitive root;
